intro: Swartzia picta var. bolivarensis, commonly known as the Bolivian pinkwood, is a species of flowering plant in the Fabaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Bolivia and Peru. The plant is characterized by its attractive, pinkish-white flowers and dense, aromatic foliage. It typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
